article.title: The Charm and Beauty of Strong Interactions

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the integral term in the quark propagator Dyson-Schwinger Equation (DSE) represent?
choices: The free propagation of the quark.
The interaction of the quark with the Higgs field.
The interaction of the quark with the gluon field.
The confinement of the quark within the hadron.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Table 1, which model consistently produces charmonium and bottomonium mass values closest to the experimental data from the Particle Data Group (PDG)?
choices: None of the models perfectly match the PDG values.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the physical significance of the weak decay constant,  f<sub>0<sup>-</sup></sub>, in Equation (10)?
choices: It represents the probability of a meson decaying through strong interactions.
It quantifies the strength of the meson\'s coupling to the electromagnetic field.
It measures the amplitude for a meson to annihilate into the vacuum.
It determines the likelihood of a meson decaying via weak interactions.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the QCD factorization of the B-meson weak decay amplitude (Equation 14), what do the terms Φ<sub>B</sub> and Φ<sub>π</sub>  represent?
